oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A RE-ANALYSIS OF THE SPECTRA OBSERVED IN JONSWAP
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Battjes, J.A.
Zitman, T.J.
Holthuijsen, L.H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: JONSWAP
wave spectra
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The frequency spectra of wind-driven waves observed during JONSWAP are re-analyzed to establish whether the Toba formulation for the highfrequency tail (~f ) fits the data better than the Phillips formulation (~f_ ) used originally in the JONSWAP project. The results indicate that the f-,*-tail provides a better fit to the observed spectra. The proportionality factor in Toba's spectrum, which is theoretically expected to be a universal constant, is found to be uncorrelated with the growth stage of the waves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 20 (1986): Proceedings of 20th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Taipei, Taiwan, 1986.; 2
